meanings.definition: A card game in which players bet on the order in which the cards will appear.
meanings.sent1: During the family gathering, they played a fun game of faro with a deck of cards.
meanings.sent2: At the casino, people enjoy playing faro and trying to predict the card sequence.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tried to join the faro game by swatting at the cards.
meanings.sent4: Her ability to strategize in faro was like a master chess player planning their moves.
meanings.sent5: The suspense in faro builds as each card is revealed, making it an exciting game.

meanings.definition: A lighthouse or beacon, especially one located at the entrance of a harbor.
meanings.sent1: The sailors relied on the faro to guide their ship safely into the harbor.
meanings.sent2: The faro's light shone brightly, guiding ships through the dark night.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous seagull perched on top of the faro, pretending to be a lookout.
meanings.sent4: The faro stood tall like a guardian, protecting ships from the treacherous rocks.
meanings.sent5: The beam from the faro cut through the fog, leading ships to safety.

meanings.definition: A gambling game in which players bet on the outcome of the roll of dice.
meanings.sent1: Friends gathered around the table to play a round of faro with dice.
meanings.sent2: In the old saloon, cowboys would often engage in intense games of faro.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous player tried to sneak an extra die into the faro game.
meanings.sent4: The outcome of the faro game was as unpredictable as the roll of the dice.
meanings.sent5: The excitement in faro heightened as the dice tumbled across the table.
